intro: Andromachia igniaria, commonly known as the firebrush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
